<body lang=EN-GB link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:36.0pt'>

<div class=WordSection1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span lang=EN-US
style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>Tutorial: Create a Simple Test<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-US style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>This
tutorial will help you create a simple test on Concerto, like this:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-US style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span lang=EN-US style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>Login to
Concerto<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span lang=EN-US style='mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>It is best
to use Google Chrome to run the Concerto administration panel. </span><span
lang=EN-US style='mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>Please
ensure that you have Concerto v3.0, the latest version. </span>Go to <span
class=SpellE><b>concerto_installation_path</b></span><b>/admin</b> and login
using your credentials. If you haven't installed Concerto on your server, you
can use our demo installation. Email&nbsp;<a href="mailto:mk583@cam.ac.uk">Michal
<span class=SpellE>Kosinski</span></a>&nbsp;to get demo account.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Demo installation:&nbsp;<a
href="http://dev.myiqtest.org/concerto/admin/">http://dev.myiqtest.org/concerto/admin/</a></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Concept<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>The test you create will be composed of three HTML
Templates:</p>

<ul style='margin-top:0cm' type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l3 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list 36.0pt'><b>Introduction</b>&nbsp;where
     the user can enter his/her name that will be used later in other HTML
     templates.</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l3 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list 36.0pt'><b>Test
     questions</b>&nbsp;- with dichotomous (yes/no) response options for
     simplicity at this stage.</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l3 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list 36.0pt'><b>Feedback</b>&nbsp;containing
     the user's score.</li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal>This tutorial is based on a very simple item bank declared
directly in the R script. However, in a proper test it is advisable to use
MySQL to store item banks, user databases, and results. Also, <span
class=SpellE><i>adaptivity</i></span> is not used in this tutorial, but you
will see how and where a bit of adaptive code can be added.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Preliminary Step: Creating a test<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Click the ‘tests’ tab on the upper left side of the page.
Click ‘+’ towards the bottom of the list, on the left side of the page, to create
a new test. Assign a relevant name for the test and click ‘OK’. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal>To edit a test (or html template) at any time, click on the
pencil symbol towards the right end of the specific test you want to edit. Be
careful not the click the last symbol on the right (bin) unless you wish to
delete your test!</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Insert
screenshot 1</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Step 1: Create HTML templates<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><i>Introduction Template<o:p></o:p></i></p>

<ul style='margin-top:0cm' type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l4 level1 lfo3'>Click the “HTML templates”
     tab on the upper left side of the page. Click the ‘+’ towards the end of
     the list of templates. Enter a name for the template (e.g. introduction) and
     click ‘save’ at the bottom of the page. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l4 level1 lfo3'>User name: Click ‘Text
     Field’ and enter a name (E.g. <span class=SpellE>user_name</span>). Click
     ‘OK’.</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l4 level1 lfo3'>Start: Click ‘Button’ and
     enter a name (e.g. <span class=SpellE>btn_start</span>), text (e.g. Start)
     and click ‘OK’.</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l4 level1 lfo3'>Type in a welcome message
     and instructions near the dialogue box, for users to fill in their name,
     and start button, for users to proceed. </li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal>Don’t forget to save the template!</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Insert
screenshot 2</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><i>Items Template<o:p></o:p></i></p>

<ul style='margin-top:0cm' type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4'>Click the “HTML templates”
     tab on the upper left side of the page. Click the ‘+’ towards the end of
     the list of templates. Enter a name for the template (e.g. items) and
     click ‘save’ at the bottom of the page. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4'>Response options: Click
     ‘Radio Button’ and assign a name (radio1) and value (0); click ‘OK’. Type <i>No</i>
     next to it. Similarly, create another radio button with the same name but
     value = 1. Type <i>Yes</i> next to it.</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4'>Submit: Click ‘Button’ and
     assign a name (<span class=SpellE>btn_submit</span>) and text value
     (Submit). Click ‘OK’.</li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4'>Edit the template and add
     suitable text above the radio buttons.</li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:72.0pt'>{{<span class=SpellE>user_name</span>}},
please answer the following question:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:72.0pt'>{{<span class=GramE>question</span>}}</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Don’t forget to save the template!</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Insert
screenshot 3</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><i>Feedback Template<o:p></o:p></i></p>

<ul style='margin-top:0cm' type=disc>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l2 level1 lfo5'>Click the “HTML templates”
     tab on the upper left side of the page. Click the ‘+’ towards the end of
     the list of templates. Enter a name for the template (e.g. feedback) and
     click ‘save’ at the bottom of the page. </li>
 <li class=MsoNormal style='mso-list:l2 level1 lfo5'>Edit template and add text
     suitable for the feedback page, including:</li>
</ul>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:36.0pt'>{{<span class=SpellE>user_name</span>}},
your total score is {{<span class=SpellE>total_score</span>}}.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Don’t forget to save the template!</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Insert
screenshot 4</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Step 2: Creating an item bank<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Click the ‘tables’ tab on the upper right side of the page
and click ‘+’ at the bottom of the list of available objects to create a new
table. Assign a name and save it.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>To add columns, click ‘+’ just below <i>table structure and
data.</i> Assign a column name (e.g. question) and the type of data it will
contain (i.e. string). Click ‘ok’. Similarly click the ‘+’ on the right side of
the column names to add a second column for answers, consisting of numeric type
data. Your item bank is nearly done.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Now you need to fill the table with the items in your test. To
add rows, click the ‘+’ below the column names. Now, you can directly type in
your items and corresponding answers. For example, see below:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Insert
screenshot 11</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Don’t forget to save your table!</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b>Step 3: Adding sections to your test<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>This step involves editing your test overall. Click the
‘tests’ tab on the upper left side of the page and click the <i>pencil symbol </i>on
your specific test to edit it. To add a new section, click the ‘+’ at the
bottom of the last section. At this point, the last section is ‘1. <span
class=GramE>start</span>’.</p>
